turns.q_en: As of 2015, regarding PRs, when can these get rejected without discussion?
turns.q_de: Aus welchen Gründen konnten PRs Stand 2015 ohne Diskussion abgelehnt werden?
turns.completed_q_en: Regarding pull requests (PRs), when can these get rejected right up front (still considering how processes were handled before 2016)?
turns.completed_q_de: Aus welchen Gründen können pull requests (PRs) direkt und ohne Diskussion abgelehnt werden (ich beziehe mich noch immer auf den Stand, wie Prozesse for 2016 gehandhabt wurden)?
turns.a: (1) PR is a large feature change or addition and should have had an RFC done first. (2) The PR does not have a ticket. (3) Someone makes a specific request for something like documentation, diagrams or other supporting material before the PR is considered.

turns.a: Five to nine individuals. The technical advisory board will have an odd number of members.

turns.q_en: What was Persaud's comments on these tests?

turns.completed_q_en: What was Rich Persaud's comments on Stable-9 rc0 tests?
turns.completed_q_de: Was hat Persaud unter den Stable-9 rc0 Tests kommentiert?
turns.a: Can we add a column for TXT, a column for SecureBoot, and measured launch test cases for valid combinations of: TPM 1.2, TPM 2.0, UEFI, SecureBoot, and TXT?

turns.q_en: And what was Chris' response?
turns.q_de: Und was war Chris' Antwort?
turns.completed_q_en: What was Chris Rogers' response to Rich Persaud's comments on Stable-9 rc0 tests?
turns.completed_q_de: Was ware Chris Rogers' Antwort auf Rich Persaud's Kommentare unter den Stable-9 rc0 Tests?
turns.a: Stable-9 always has TXT on for both legacy and UEFI cases.  SecureBoot is only supported on UEFI, and UEFI is only supported on TPM 2.0.  Therefore the only additional configuration not currently tested in this matrix is TPM 2.0, UEFI, SecureBoot.  This will be added to the RC2 test run. Overall, the Measured Launch testcases in this matrix: verifying that MLE boot succeeds, measured PCRs are correct, forward sealing succeeds, and upgrades succeed are, I believe, thorough evaluations of the state of Measured Launch on the platform.

turns.q_en: What is VirtIO?
turns.q_de: Was ist VirtIO?
turns.completed_q_en: What is VirtIO in this context?
turns.completed_q_de: Was ist VirtIO in diesem Zusammenhang?
turns.a: VirtIO is a virtual device driver standard developed originally for the Linux kernel, drawing upon the lessons learned during the development of paravirtualized device drivers for Xen, KVM and other hypervisors.

turns.q_en: Which critical needs will be satisfied by allowing VirtIO to use Argo?
turns.q_de: Welche kritischen Anforderungen werden erfüllt,wenn man VirtIO erlaubt,Argo zu nutzen?
turns.completed_q_en: What critical requirements will be addressed by enabling Virtio to use the Argo interdomain communication mechanism for data transport across the VM boundary?
turns.completed_q_de: Welche kritischen Anforderungen werden erfüllt,wenn man VirtIO erlaubt,den Argo-Interdomain-Kommunikationsmechanismus für den Datentransport über die VM-Grenze zu nutzen?
turns.a: (1) Preserve strong isolation between the two ends of the split device driver; (2) Enable enforcement of granular mandatory access control policy over the communicating endpoints.; (3) Enable Argo support in the mainline Linux kernel.

turns.q_en: How many avenues does OpenXT use for inter-domain communication?
turns.q_de: Wie viele Wege nutzt OpenXT für die Inter-Domain-Kommunikation?
turns.completed_q_en: How many techniques does OpenXT use for inter-domain communication?
turns.completed_q_de: Wie viele Techniken nutzt OpenXT für die Inter-Domain-Kommunikation?
turns.a: Two: (1) Xen PV drivers; (2) Argo, with an Argo Linux device driver

turns.q_en: What is the the SELinux policy language based on?

turns.q_en: Cooperating technologies in SELinux?
turns.q_de: Welche kooperierenden Technologien gibt es in SELinux?
turns.completed_q_en: What are the cooperating in SELinux?
turns.completed_q_de: Was sind die kooperierenden in SELinux?
turns.a: (1) The SELinux policy is written in a language based on Type Enforcement (TE). (2) The Linux Kernel was modified to add access control hooks to code paths accessing kernel objects. (3) The reference policy (refpol) which is the one true policy maintained by the community. (4) There is a set of userland tools for managing SELinux.

turns.a: (1) Provide the software platform for a Multi-Tenant Client Desktop; (2) Provide the software platform for a hardened Single-VM endpoint.

turns.completed_q_de: Wie kann man Änderungen an dem Tech1: OpenXT Platform Architecture Dokument vornehmen?

turns.q_de: Ist diese Dokumentation fertiggestellt?

turns.completed_q_de: Ist das Tech1: OpenXT Platform Architecture Dokument fertiggestellt?

turns.q_en: what info is available on derivative works?
turns.q_de: Welche Informationen sind über abgeleitete Werke verfügbar?
turns.completed_q_en: What information is available on derivative works in the Tech1: OpenXT Platform Architecure document?
turns.completed_q_de: Welche Informationen sind über abgeleitete Werke im Tech1: OpenXT Platform Architecture Dokument?
turns.a: Derivative works rely on OpenXT Platform Properties to make assurances for diverse markets and use cases. Derivative works are developed and governed independently of the OpenXT Project. Developers of derivative works can propose technical changes to the OpenXT Platform, as defined by Project Changes in the Tech1: OpenXT Platform Architecture document.

turns.q_en: when can a pr get rejected upfront?

turns.completed_q_de: Wann kann ein Pull Request (PR) im Voraus abgelehnt werden,wie im frühen Entwurf zur OpenXT-Projekt-Governance erwähnt?
turns.a: (1) The PR is a large feature change or addition and should have had an RFC done first; (2) The PR does not have a ticket. Aside from very minor PRs e.g. say one to un-break the build, all PRs should have a ticket; (3) Someone makes a specific request for something like documentation, diagrams or other supporting material before the PR is considered.

turns.q_en: could you please summarize dbd replacement for me?
turns.q_de: könnten Sie bitte den DBD-Ersatz für mich zusammenfassen?
turns.completed_q_en: Could you please summarize DBD (.neXT) replacement?
turns.completed_q_de: Könnten Sie bitte den DBD (.neXT)-Ersatz zusammenfassen?
turns.a: Two major chunks of technical debt is the lack of proper ocaml & Haskell cross compilation support in the OE toolchain.  Much of the toolstack is written against old versions and library and require significant work to overhaul to a modern version, even if the cross compiler were implemented properly in bitbake/openembedded. Additionally, dbd has a major outstanding bug, which has yet to be addressed due to lack of maintainers with adequate ocaml experience. The scope of this RFC feature page is on replacing dbd and the client tools, db-tools, with compatible replacements. A proposed replacement has been written in C++, using support QT libraries (qtbase).

turns.q_en: could you please repeat the two points on technical debt?
turns.q_de: könnten Sie bitte die beiden Punkte zu technischen Schulden wiederholen?
turns.completed_q_en: What are the two main topics on technical debt in the summary of DBD (.neXT) replacement?
turns.completed_q_de: Was sind die beiden Hauptthemen zu technischen Schulden in der Zusammenfassung des DBD (.neXT)-Ersatzes?
turns.a: (1) Lack of proper ocaml; (2) Lack of Haskell cross compilation support in the OE toolchain.

turns.q_en: who's the owner?
turns.q_de: wer ist der Eigentümer?
turns.completed_q_en: Who is the owner of the project on DBD (.neXT)?
turns.completed_q_de: Wer ist der Eigentümer des Projekts auf DBD (.neXT)?

turns.q_en: what's the status on reducing technical debt?
turns.q_de: wie ist der Status bei der Reduzierung technischer Schulden?
turns.completed_q_en: Is anything documented on reducing technical debt in the context of DBD (.neXT)?
turns.completed_q_de: Ist irgendetwas über die Reduzierung technischer Schulden im Zusammenhang mit DBD (.neXT) dokumentiert?
turns.a: It continues paying off technical debt, replacing an ocaml daemon with something that properly cross compiles and has up-to-date dependencies.

turns.q_en: basic approaches for testing OpenXT pull request processes?
turns.q_de: grundlegende Ansätze zum Testen von OpenXT-Pull-Request-Prozessen?
turns.completed_q_en: What are the basic approaches for testing OpenXT Pull Request (PR) processes?
turns.completed_q_de: Was sind die grundlegenden Ansätze zum Testen von OpenXT-Pull-Request-Prozessen (PR)?
turns.a: The basic approaches are: (1) A full build on the build server with the PR specific changes in it is done then tested against instructions the author provides. This is done for large PRs (like new features) or PRs that not easily tested in isolation; (2) A partial build of the modules/components is done by one of us and tested in an existing build against instructions the author provides. This is done for smaller scope PRs where the changes are more isolated; (3) A full build on the build server with the PR specific changes where the success of the build is the only acceptance criterion. This is rare and is usually related to changes that only effect the build environment; (4) Testing is not done and we rely solely on inspection and review. This is exceedingly rare and only happens when the change is trivial or there are extenuating circumstances. The reasons for using this approach would be cited in the PR and/or the ticket.

turns.q_en: However the VM is not guaranteed to be the same resolution as the displays (i.e. the display handler might reduce the size of the VM to make room for banner markings). For example, if the display is physically 1920x1080, but the Display Handler wishes to reserve a 100 pixel tall banner at the top, the Display Handler will report back to the VM driver that the display is 1820x1080..?
turns.q_de: jedoch kann nicht garantiert werden,dass die VM dieselbe Auflösung wie die Displays hat (d. h. der Display-Handler könnte die Größe der VM reduzieren,um Platz für Banner-Markierungen zu schaffen). Ich gehe davon aus,dass dies hinter dem Rücken der VM geschieht. Das heißt,der Display-Handler teilt dem VM-Treiber die NUTZBARE Größe des Displays mit,nicht unbedingt die TATSÄCHLICHE Größe des Displays. Wenn das Display beispielsweise physisch 1920 x 1080 Pixel groß ist,der Display-Handler jedoch oben ein 100 Pixel hohes Banner reservieren möchte,meldet der Display-Handler dem VM-Treiber,dass das Display 182 0x1080...?

I assume that this happens behind the VM's back. That is, the Display Handler will tell the VM driver the USABLE size of the display, not necessarily the ACTUAL size of the display. For example, if the display is physically 1920x1080, but the Display Handler wishes to reserve a 100 pixel tall banner at the top, the Display Handler will report back to the VM driver that the display is 1820x1080?
turns.completed_q_de: Für Windows XPDM PV Display Driver und Miniport ist jedoch nicht garantiert,dass die VM die gleiche Auflösung wie die Displays hat (d. h. der Display-Handler könnte die Größe der VM reduzieren,um Platz für Banner-Markierungen zu schaffen). Ich gehe davon aus,dass dies hinter dem Rücken der VM geschieht. Das heißt,der Display-Handler teilt dem VM-Treiber die NUTZBARE Größe des Displays mit,nicht unbedingt die TATSÄCHLICHE Größe des Displays. Wenn die Anzeige beispielsweise physisch 1920 x 1080 Pixel groß ist,der Display-Handler jedoch oben ein 100 Pixel hohes Banner reservieren möchte,meldet der Display-Handler dem VM-Treiber,dass die Anzeige 1820 x 1080 Pixel groß ist?
turns.a: Confirmed correct. VM driver can select a different resolution than Display Handler requests. If VM resolution doesn't match Display Handler resolution, Display Handler will scale. This should be avoided.

turns.q_en: primary benefit of the single customization layer?

turns.completed_q_en: What is the main advantage of having a single customization layer, as per the Derivative Customization RFC?
turns.completed_q_de: Was ist der Hauptvorteil einer einzelnen Anpassungsschicht gemäß dem RFC für die derivative Anpassung?
turns.a: Only one extra repository needs to be tracked for build and CI/CD purposes, and it is not a fork of any existing repository.

turns.q_en: finally, could you please tell me a bit about the background of the oxt derivative customization rfc?
turns.q_de: könnten Sie mir bitte abschließend etwas über den Hintergrund des oxt-Derivat-Anpassungs-RFC erzählen?
turns.completed_q_en: Could you please tell me a bit about the background of the OpenXT derivative customization RFC?
turns.completed_q_de: Könnten Sie mir bitte etwas über den Hintergrund des OpenXT-Derivat-Anpassungs-RFC erzählen?
turns.a: OpenXT has historically served as an open-source base implementation of a secure, client virtualization solution.  The build process readily supports a modular inclusion or exclusion of components depending on the individual usecase.  Often times, closed source derivative products or projects that are based on OpenXT have unique usecases that require this modular replacement driven by requirements, operating constraints, or other limitations.  One way to handle managing such a project is to fork the OpenXT repos so that the derivative project can maintain tighter control over the version control system, components, configuration and code to provide releases at their own cadence.  The downside to this approach is that development that could be pushed back upstream to OpenXT is often put on the back burner or otherwise delayed due to scheduling or other resource constraints.  It is healthier for OpenXT to further support the derivative usecases such that these forks become used sparingly or are eliminated altogether; upstreamable work is done directly in OpenXT rather than in the downstream and pushed back up at a later time.  Therefore, this RFC outlines a process for implementing and supporting a single customization layer to create a derivative build.
